summary.para: Adds a cubic polynomial segment that describes the shape of a transition curve to the animation function.

param.name: dimension
param.para: The dimension in which to apply the new segment.

param.name: beginOffset
param.para: The begin offset for the segment, where 0 corresponds to the start of the transition.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

remarks.para: This method will fail with an error code of UI_E_INVALID_PRIMITIVE if the start time is either less than 0 or less than the start time of a previous segment.

summary.para: Adds a sinusoidal segment that describes the shape of a transition curve to the animation function.

param.name: dimension
param.para: The dimension in which to apply the new segment.

param.name: beginOffset
param.para: The begin offset for the segment, where 0 corresponds to the start of the transition.

param.name: bias
param.para: The bias constant in the sinusoidal function.

param.name: amplitude
param.para: The amplitude constant in the sinusoidal function.

param.name: frequency
param.para: The frequency constant in the sinusoidal function.

param.name: phase
param.para: The phase constant in the sinusoidal function.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

remarks.para: Defined by the function Y(t) = bias + amplitudesin(360frequency*t + phase), where 'sin' is the sin of an angle specified in degrees (for example, sin(n + 360) == sin(n) for any real number 'n').
This method will fail with an error code of UI_E_INVALID_PRIMITIVE if the start time is either less than 0 or less than the start time of a previous segment.

summary.para: Defines a method that allows a custom interpolator to provide transition information, in the form of a cubic polynomial curve, to the animation manager.
